title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. Steps To Reproduce: start WSWB and create a new project, create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select 'Shut Down...' command to shutdown/reboot the computer. Results: There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s). The computer is shut down/rebooted immediately. Other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook etc.)
SR: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows should display a warning or question message box, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s), before proceeding with the shut down/reboot process. To reproduce: start WSWB and create a new project, create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select 'Shut Down...' command to shutdown/reboot the computer. Expected behavior: A warning or question message box should appear, prompting users to save their dirty model(s) before proceeding with the shut down/reboot process.
